page.title: 19MAGPIES AND JAYS
page.content: When I first moved into the area I had rarely seen a magpie and I had never seen a jay.One of the local pubs-'The 3 Jays'gave me a clue to the treats I had in store in the ornithological sense.The now ubiquitous magpie with its superstitious reputation is the most successful bird species in the area and although it is a scavenger and an opportunist its marvellous black,white and blue plumage gives delight to those who see it. The jay,although common is much less readily seen and it appears to be a very shy bird even though it has little reason to be.Its classic multi -coloured plumage is a lovely sight in the early morning though a pair of arguing jays might keep one awake at night with their raucous cries.There are also a multitude of other species to delight the bird-fancier.
